intro: Myxopyrum ellipticilimbum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Myxopyrum ellipticilimbum thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. It is often found in association with other aquatic and semi-aquatic plants in freshwater environments.
